content.description: Easy climbing up to the first ledge. After that the route cranks up to 11 and doesn't take it's foot off the gas until the clipping jug at the chains. Classic for the wall, don't miss this one.
content.location: Start just right of Plaguewielder. Trend up and right through the largest section of tiered roofs.

content.description: Climb up ledges to an outta-nowhere crimpy boulder problem at about 25 ft. Pull the roof and surf jugs to the top.
content.location: Currently the furthest right route on the orange wall

climbs.name: Pumpkin Pie
climbs.fa: Uli, Chris Mallott, and Paige Jones

content.description: Step up the slab, pass through 2 feet of crusty choss flakes and then enjoy your fill of sweet Pumpkin Pie. Great rock and cool rails make a recipe for great fun and the best warm up around. Stays dry from rain.
content.location: Just left of the large rectangular boulder on the ground. Currently the right most climb on the Orange wall. Ends below a 5 foot roof.

content.description: Easy terrain takes you to a choss ledge, but don't let that discourage you. Once you leave the ledge the rock gets incredible with complex and interesting movement. The crux of this route is right in the middle, and definitely suits a taller climber better. However, there might be sneakyÂ shorty beta that just hasn't been found yet.
content.location: Furthest left route on the Orange Wall. Goes straight up.

content.description: Romp up the ramp of ledges to the beautiful lichen covered wall. Big moves on good holds is the name of the game. Survive the multiple roof encounters and a pumpy face section on perfect crimps and edges. Contender for best 5.11 at the crag sure to put a crooked smile on your face.
content.location: Climbs right of the flake with 2 x's on it.

content.description: The second wall you come to when hiking in from the campsite. The Orange Wall only has 5 routes on it at the moment.. The stone after the ledge is legendary, make sure to get on these at some point!
